title: Determining the Rate of Expansion
content: Click and drag on the plot to add a trendline that best fits your data. The slope of this trendline is known as the Hubble Constant, which indicates the rate of expansion for the Universe.

question.title: Question #7
question.label: Click and drag anywhere on the Hubble plot to add a trendline

question.title: Question #7.1
question.label: Scientists currently estimate the Hubble Constant to be between 67.7 and 74.0 (km/s)/Mpc. How does your value of the Hubble Constant compare to these values?
